title: Connection Puzzle
description: Find the hidden connection! What do these items all have in common?

questions.question: What do Earth, a basketball, and a pizza all have in common?
questions.explanation: Earth, basketballs, and pizzas are all round in shape — a sphere, a ball, and a circle respectively.

questions.question: What do shoes, gloves, and earrings all have in common?
options: They are worn on the hands
questions.explanation: Shoes, gloves, and earrings all come in pairs — you need two to make a complete set.

questions.question: What do an airplane, a bird, and a kite all have in common?
options: They are all made of metal
questions.explanation: Airplanes, birds, and kites all fly through the air, though each uses a different method to achieve flight.

questions.question: What do a piano, a computer, and a lock all have in common?
questions.explanation: A piano has musical keys, a computer has keyboard keys, and a lock is opened with a key — they all have keys!

questions.question: What do Saturn, a boxing ring, and a telephone all have in common?
questions.explanation: Saturn has planetary rings, boxing has a ring where fighters compete, and a telephone rings when someone calls.

questions.question: What do a king, a tooth, and the Statue of Liberty all have in common?
questions.explanation: A king wears a crown, a tooth has a dental crown, and the Statue of Liberty wears a crown with seven rays.

questions.question: What do a dog, a comet, and a kite all have in common?
questions.explanation: A dog wags its tail, a comet has a glowing tail of gas and dust, and a kite flies with a tail for stability.

questions.question: What do a bottle, a guitar, and a giraffe all have in common?
questions.explanation: A bottle has a narrow neck, a guitar has a neck where the fretboard is, and a giraffe is famous for its long neck.

questions.question: What do a clock, a deck of cards, and a human all have in common?
questions.explanation: A clock has hour and minute hands, a card game deals hands of cards, and humans have two hands.

questions.question: What do temperature, angles, and burns all have in common?
options: They are all measured in degrees
questions.explanation: Temperature is measured in degrees (Fahrenheit or Celsius), angles are measured in degrees, and burns are classified by degree (first, second, third).

questions.question: What do a fish, a musical composition, and Lady Justice all have in common?
options: They are all found in water
questions.explanation: A fish has scales on its body, music uses scales (sequences of notes), and Lady Justice holds scales to weigh evidence.

questions.question: What do a river crossing, a guitar, and a dental procedure all have in common?
questions.explanation: Rivers are crossed by bridges, a guitar has a bridge that holds the strings, and dentists create dental bridges to replace missing teeth.

questions.question: What do a river, money, and snow all have in common?
questions.explanation: A river has riverbanks, money is stored in banks, and snow piles up in snowbanks.

questions.question: What do a prison, a chocolate candy, and a piece of music all have in common?
questions.explanation: A prison has bars on its windows, chocolate comes in bars, and music is divided into bars (measures).

questions.question: What do a computer, a poker game, and a cookie all have in common?
questions.explanation: Computers use microchips, poker games use betting chips, and cookies can have chocolate chips.
